title: Arctic Research Equipment Redistribution
content: A consortium of polar researchers operates multiple remote research bases (depots) across the Arctic. They need to redistribute scientific equipment—such as weather sensors, drilling tools, and lab gear—to isolated research stations (customers). Each vehicle has a strict weight capacity (<capacity> kg) to carry equipment, and routes must be completed within a 12-hour window (<time_limit>) to avoid dangerous night driving or sudden storms. Vehicles depart from different depots and end their routes at the final station without returning, ensuring researchers can begin work immediately. The challenge is to balance depot assignments, respect capacity limits, and minimize total travel distance while adhering to safety time constraints.
